main.java.ui

Class Answer

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.shape.Shape
        • javafx.scene.text.Text
          • main.java.ui.Answer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Answer>, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class Answer
extends javafx.scene.text.Text
implements java.lang.Comparable<Answer>
    The Answer Class represents an Answer in the Sudoku game. This is a number that appears to completely fill the given square. It can have many colors, though three are reserved: Black is a starting answer, Green is a given answer, and Dark Red is an incorrect answer. Any other color represents the player who correctly answered that square.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Answer

        public Answer()
        Creates a new answer, with default font size of 50 and is not visible.

    • Method Detail

      • setValue

        public void setValue(int ans)
        Sets the value of the answer. If it is not between 1 and 9, the value is set to 0 and the Answer is not visible.
        Parameters:
        ans - The integer that represents the answer.

      • getValue

        public int getValue()
        Gets the value of this Answer, as an integer.
        Returns:
        The integer value.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        A Convenience method that will set the text to nothing, make it invisible, and reset the value to 0.

      • getVisible

        public boolean getVisible()
        A method that tells whether or not this Answer is visible.
        Returns:
        A boolean that tells whether or not the Answer is visible.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Answer answer)
        Compares this Answer to a given Answer.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Answer>
        Parameters:
        answer - The answer object we are comparing to.
        Returns:
        An integer that is positive if this square has a greater value than the given square.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Two Answers are equivalent if their values are the same and their fills are the same. It will throw an IllegalArgumentException if the given Object is not of class Answer.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        object - The object we are comparing to.
        Returns:
        A boolean defining whether or not the two Answers are equivalent.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns the hash of this answer, defined as a combination of the answer and it's color components.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The hash code.
